owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._paymentMethod: The payment method to remove the verifier for.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._paymentMethod: The payment method to set the verifier for.
params._verifier: The address of the verifier to set.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._verifyPaymentData: Payment proof, intent details, and payment method required for verification

addCurrency(bytes32).notice: OWNER ONLY: Adds a currency code to supported currencies

removeCurrency(bytes32).notice: OWNER ONLY: Removes a currency code from supported currencies

removePaymentMethodVerifier(uint8).notice: ONLY OWNER: Removes the verifier for a payment method.

setPaymentMethodVerifier(uint8,address).notice: ONLY OWNER: Sets the verifier for a payment method.

setTimestampBuffer(uint256).notice: OWNER ONLY: Sets the timestamp buffer for payments. This is the amount of time in seconds that the timestamp can be off by and still be considered valid. Necessary to build in flexibility  with L2 timestamps.

verifyPayment((bytes,address,uint256,uin.notice: ONLY RAMP: Verifies a reclaim proof of an offchain Zelle payment. Because Zelle supports multiple payment methods  (each with their own verification logic), the _verifyPaymentData.paymentProof field should contain the payment method. Payment method should be encodePacked with the payment proof. We chose this over encoding it as (uint8, bytes) because computation is cheaper on L2 than calldata.
